title: Lonely runner conjecture
summary: In number theory, specifically the study of Diophantine approximation, the lonely runner conjecture is a conjecture about the long-term behavior of runners on a circular track. It states that n {\displaystyle n} runners on a track of unit length, with constant speeds all distinct from one another, will each be lonely at some timeâ€”at least 1 / n {\displaystyle 1/n} units away from all others.
